New Records: England are the first men's team to be world champions in both ODIs and T20s
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes hits a full toss from Wasim to reach his first ever T20I half-century
Ben Stokes smashes the winning runs!
Stokes survives an appeal for caught behind after missing an attempted slog
Naseem Shah is 19 years old, and he is bowling one of the great wicketless spells
Ben Stokes, the pathological winner, could be doing it in a World Cup final again!
Haris Rauf strikes in his first over! Salt, who looked a bit jittery, slugs a pull straight to midwicket and goes for 10 from nine balls
Jos Buttler and Ben Stokes are at the crease in a World Cup final again
Jos Buttler felt instinctively for a very sharp delivery – he didn’t need to play - and nicked it through to Rizwan
Pre-Game Insights: England win the toss and bowl first
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler walks over to join his teammates, silly grin plastered all over his face, and lifts the World T20 trophy to the heavens!
Jos Buttler is holding his child and hugging his mum
Jos Buttler speaks: 'I’m immensely proud of everyone here. Matthew Mott’s doing alright, isn’t he?'
Babar Azam speaks: 'First of all congratulations to England – they are deserved champions.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The injury to Shaheen Shah Afridi, who hurt his knee while catching Harry Brook, may well have decided the game
Naseem Shah’s figures of 4-0-30-0 are an utter scandal

The presentation is under way. Sam Curran walks up to officially receive his player of the match award, and his player of the tournament award, and his wide yorker of the tournament award, and his into-the-pitch slower ball of the tournament award
Others: The England team go up to receive their winners’ medals
Adil Rashid comes over for a chat with the Sky team, pats Eoin Morgan on the back and says ‘thank you for picking me in 2015!’
